reviews.review: first things first, it's a sith holocron not a way finder. this was a terrible movie. even my 12 year old son didn't like it. it was thrown together and inconsistent. just go ahead and scrap the trilogy and let George Lucas remake it!

Not only did I leave the movie theater emotionally distraught, but it ruined the entire trilogy for me. Absolutely heartbroken that this is the way Star Wars ends. The gaping plot holes and blatant disregard of character arcs was enough to ruin it, but that ending was what really did it for me. JJ Abrams took the hope that George Lucas built up and stepped on it, spit on it, set it on fire, and left it in a dumpster.
The iMAX quality was amazing however, the story-telling is mediocre and Disney has relied on gratuitous cameos and references while altering canonical laws. Sorry, meh is the best I can give this.
What a mess! The critics are right, this film tries to serve the past successes and fails to bring anything fresh to the series. I am left wondering what the point of the latest trilogy has been.
Amazing ending to an amazing story!

After The Last Jedi, I was disappointed with how VII and VIII had seemed to completely abandon the themes from the first six installments. Indeed, I felt that The Last Jedi worked to destroy the character of Luke Skywalker as we knew him. Now, in Disney's last chance to prove itself on the Star Wars front, it does just that, returning to old motifs and delivering an ending that nearly redeems this entire new-age trilogy in my eyes. My major critique is that, especially for JJ Abrams, much of the dialogue was corny and at times felt like I was watching a bad sit-com. Despite this, both the action scenes and inner-conflict that presents itself within our characters allow The Rise of Skywalker to conclude the new story in a memorable and graceful way.
Great effects. Fun, action filled story. JJ Abrams brought together the old and new elements. Recommended.

I was 10 when this started and it was always supposed to be a hail to the old Saturday movie serials.   This was fantastic and lived up to the original tenet.  The critics were wrong. It was always about entertaining. And that it did!!

I'm glad that they went back and included much of the lore that had dropped off the books once Disney bought LucasArts. I also appreciated how they undid some of the confusing elements of The Last Jedi. I feel like it will lead to a better place moving forward as Disney helms more Star Wars properties.
Excellent conclusion to the Skywalker Saga.
